FuncDef: The display cfm mep command displays information about a maintenance association end point (MEP) in a specified maintenance domain (MD) and maintenance association (MA).
CLIs: display cfm mep [ md <md-name> [ ma <ma-name> [ mep-id <mep-id> ] ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the MEPs in a specified MD. If md md-name is not specified, information about the MEPs in all MDs and MAs on the device is displayed.
md-name specifies the name of an MD. The value is a string of 1 to 43 characters. Question marks (?) are not supported.

Displays information about the MEPs in a specified MA. If md-name is specified and ma-name is not specified, information about the MEPs in all MAs in the specified MD is displayed.
ma-name specifies the name of an MA. The value is a string of 1 to 43 characters. Question marks (?) are not supported.

Displays information about a specified MEP.
mep-id specifies the ID of a MEP. The ID is an integer ranging from 1 to 8191.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display cfm mep md md1 ma ma1 mep-id 1
L2TPV3 Tunnel Name : dot1q L2TPV3 Local Connection Name     : --
<HUAWEI> display cfm mep md md1 ma ma1 mep-id 1
L2VPN Name         : --  CE ID              : --  CE Offset          : --
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a MEP is configured or connectivity fault management (CFM) fails, you can run the display cfm mep command to check the configurations on the MEP.
